page.title: 06SCREDINGTON RECOLLECTIONS.
page.content: Mrs Bell is an old lady who has lived in Scredington all her life."The school is similar to what it is now.There was an Infant room and a Junior room.There was a big slab in the playground to separate the boys from the girls.We didnt wear a uniform.The lessons were just writing and arithmetic .There were no organised games.There was a village shop .Every Sunday we went to the chapel Sunday School.It was a big Sunday School.The event of the year was the outing to Bell house farm.We all used to pile into a cart pulled by horses and sit in the barn for refreshments.It was the most exiting thing happened to me.We used to live in a farmhouse and we had horses. My dad worked on the land and earned 28 shillings a week.In other ways village life has changed very little."
